ABOUT TIGA
2007 – Present, “Ciao Means Forever”
Sometime in 2007, Tiga achieved Full Online Consciousness. This has given him the ability to speak directly to you through the computer, a miracle you will only now come to fully appreciate:

My Name Is Tiga. Welcome to the Bio-Dome, mec!

As you know, my remix work has slowed considerably as of late. While my versions of tracks by Alter Ego, New Young Pony Club, The Gossip and Human League have only enhanced my reputation as the Sex Whiz of Sonic Parkour, I felt I needed to start hoarding my best ideas for my own music. The remix of Alter Ego’s “Gary”, for instance, forced me to cannibalize much of the work I’d done in my now-legendary sessions with Bobby McFerrin. It was then that I knew that I had to draw the line.

The seeds for ZZT, my ongoing collaboration with Zombie Nation, when we hit it off at the semi-biannual Gigolo High-Earners Galmour Pageant and Hot Meal. After falling out with Gigolo over accusations of cyber-arson, I approached him about working together, possibly on music. I soon came to love his thing-throwing, humor-having ways. Our tracks tend to be “live” in nature, in that we try to only use parts that require four hands at a time. Or 19 fingers and three lips. It depends.

Rainier Werner Bassfinder takes everything great about my work with Jesper Dahlback and takes it to a new level. One that forces me to use a fake name. I chose the moniker “The Dove” for reasons contractual and shame-based. Probably 70/30, contract/shame. Oh, Michael Gothard, I only wanted to do right by you!

Over the past few years, I have continued to tour the globe extensively. I have eaten Club Sandwiches in over 60 countries and done “The Sandwich” in over 600 clubs. I was also brave enough to visit the Middle East, with a harrowing trip to war-ravaged Dubai. I was taken falconing (this is 100 percent true), which was strange enough before I found out that the falcons undergo extensive plastic surgery to look more like celebrities. My falcon, I was told, was supposed to resemble Ethan Hawke. I don’t know who that is.

The past few years have also seen a resurgence at my record label, Turbo. The work done by Thomas Von Party in A&R and Oliver Interactive in International Business Affairs has been invaluable. I can’t express how much I appreciate their efforts in making Turbo the Towerhorse it is today. I would be remiss, however, in not mentioning the real star of the show, our Branding Consultant, Brandon Branding.

Brandon saw ways of expanding our brand in new and exciting directions. He insisted I start participating in community soccer leagues to lend an “everyman” quality to my daunting brilliance. I was skeptical at first, but soon I came to treasure seeing the faces of 50-year-old men in goggles light up as I take the field. I am a defense-minded, vaguely passive-aggressive midfielder, and have trained online with Ghana international Michael Essien.

Mr. Branding also encouraged me to write for the label, birthing a torrid run of press sheets that has sparked in me a love of letters deep and true. Now I write all the time. I even replaced my car’s paneling with dry-erase board, so that I may lean out the driver’s seat window at a moment’s notice to scrawl away at the face of literature.

Today, our reach extends even further, thanks to my venturing into the world of amateur inventing. There’s the Grocery Claw, aimed at those who rightly abhor what I call Market Filth. And, with an eye towards the future of our planet, Solar-Powered Wind.

Most importantly, 2009 will see the release of my new LP, “Ciao!” This album will surely cement my status as a Storytella and Funky Fella. “Ciao!” is the fruit of 15 months of collaborations with such leading lights as Soulwax, Jesper Dahlback, Gonzales, Jori Hulkonnen, Jake Shears and James Murphy. An impressive roster, to say the least. What was that? What do you mean, “What?” That sound you just made! It was like a snort, a dismissive snort. have you worked with, then, genius? Sting Jr.? That weirdo form Simply Red? Lady Sting? I am not impressed in the least.

All in all, at the end of the day, I can’t help but gaze into the reflecting pool and think to myself, “I guess I really turned the night on, huh?”

1976 – 2003, “The Creation Myth”
“The citizen may take a bride, but it is the rifleman who takes a lover. Ultimately we all must choose either the myth or the mountain.”

The origins of Montreal born DJ-producer-incipient Teutonic legend Tiga lie to the vague and troubling East, where he was weaned on the nefarious milk of the notorious 1980s Indian club scene.“To the unforgiving eye,” he says of the sybaritic night-kingdom,“a world of filth and decadence is revealed. For example, I’m fairly certain that more than a few club owners had an unsavory arrangement with the man who brought the folding chairs. I was at once appalled and enraptured. After that, I had no choice in the matter.”

By 1990, Tiga had returned to Montreal, prodigiously nightwise and unsatisfied with the existing local club scene (calling it “the plumage of a bird I cannot bring myself to want.”) With the help of a core group of friends, he began to throw a series of small parties infused with the sense of dead-eyed ennui gleaned from a past littered with acid whores and crazed Indian gamblers. Other innovations which Tiga introduced to Montreal party culture include guest DJs, intense street promotions featuring rival gangs of street acrobats, color flyers, multi-dj sets, and leading the supplicant crowd through the innermost corridors of one’s soul.

It was this heady time of dizzying innovation and ravenous sexual ambition, which culminated in the birth of 1993’s “Solstice,” generally, considered to be Montreal’s first genuine rave. (A year earlier, a hyper-prescient Tiga staged “Eclectricity,” the first online rave, a project whose utter failure remains a source of bafflement: “It broke my heart, given my views on diversity . . . I am, I feel, a very interactive person.”) Tiga has since helped to orchestrate no less than ten major events, including “The Orb Live,” “Pure,” and the very first North American appearance of continental illusionist Jean-There.

In 1994, Tiga bought DNA Records, a small medical data concern, and parlayed it into Montreal’s premiere electronic music boutique. “We’ve always believed in putting the customer first, from helping you find that one minimal house record that will make your collection to offering concerned looks as you wade through the enormous backlog of test results to discover if you are in fact afflicted with a congenital disease.”

In 1996, Tiga privately sang about the death of actor and poet Tupac Shakur.
That same year, the Montreal dance community found a haven for the boldest feats of dance, where fools are in love with mystery and sex-valor is prized above all else. Sona (meaning literally ‘Liar-dancer’) was initially conceived of by Tiga and his two partners as “a perverse, jeering monolith, because nothing is sacred anymore” but it has evolved into much more. In addition to its place among the pantheon of urban groove centers, on weekdays it rents out its facilities, at a very reasonable rate, to a local program dedicated to teaching homeless men to dance properly (“I just think it’s an important project,” Tiga said at the time).

In 1998, Tiga started Turbo Recordings as an outlet for his wildman organ escapades but he soon found a host of other artists who were willing to be paid to record for him. Turbo has released over 20 albums, 2 samplers, and 12 vinyl twelve inches as well as secured global distribution with Prime, Intergroove and Caroline. Notable releases include Peter Benisch’s “Soundtrack Saga,” Christopher Handlebar’s “To a Time of Asia” and Tiga’s own “Mixed Emotions” and “American Gigolo”

By 2001, however, overwork and media saturation began to show their strain, as evidenced by Tiga’s hysterical outburst at a fashion photographer during a promo shoot:

“I’ll sit for your venal cigarette pictures, but I will not indulge you in your game of ‘Eyes! Lies! Surprise!’ I dare you, coward—call out your cloakmen! What are you waiting for? The truth?!”

Following a month spent riding horses and caring for his voice, Tiga entered the studio with producer Zyntherius “Jori” Hulkonnen and a singular vision: “electro, but mainly about my eyes.” The result, a searing rendition of his former Mother Mio bandmate Corey Hart’s solo smash “Sunglasses at Night,” challenged dancers and seduced critics alike, yet Tiga is coy when asked about its impact, particularly in Germany: “’Sunglasses’ is a sinless child, a gleaming medallion. But is also a trick, a trick of memory. You must understand – on a whim, we revealed the hidden fire of Europe.”

But fires need tending and lumber. And so the onslaught of Tiga-powered releases was fated to continue. They are his craft, his life, his living craft-fire.

“We live in the Age of Cruelty and every day I struggle to find my place in it. All I know I can offer the world is a thousand more adventures through dancing and light.”

2003 – 2006, “Get on Top of the Fire”
If “Sunglasses at Night” marked Tiga’s coronation as the steely Wolf-King of Dance Mountain, then his subsequent remixes for the likes of Martini Bros., Alpinestars, Linda Lamb, Crossover, FC Kahuna, Cabaret Voltaire, Telepopmusik, Felix da Housecat, Fischerspooner, FPU, The Devils (Nick Rhodes), and Danni Minogue birthed his dewy-eyed heir, Darian. Says Tiga, “I have also produced remixes for City Rockers, and singles for Turbo Recordings, Intec, Drumcode, and Electrix with Mateo Murphy under the name TGV. I am also the hidden hero of the ongoing NHL lockout. I will break the players’ will – you have my solemn word.”

In 2003, Tiga took his conqueror’s tools to the streets, with a heralded mix CD for !K7’s DJ Kicks series, and an ethereal reading of Nelly’s “Hot in Herre,” which became a stalwart success and was subsequently licensed in the UK by Skint (in the UK) and Warner Music (the GAS region). The video, which can be seen at http://www.eyeballnyc.com/tiga, is a revelation of neo-urban dazzle-do, courtesy of the puppet wizardry of Tiga’s brother, the Lord of the Marionette (www.lordofthemarionette.com).

Tiga was also gracious enough to lend his wind-shattering vocals to Richard X’s “You (Better Let Me Love YouX4) Tonight,” as well as “Heartbreak/Ananda,” by Beyer & Lenk (Adam Beyer and Jesper Dahlback), and Rik Stamina’s “Dancing Inside You.” His remix work on Alex Kidd’s “Come With Me”, Neon Judgement’s “TV Treated,” Scissor Sisters’ cover of Pink Floyd’s “Comfortably Numb,” “Da Hype,” by Junior Jack and Robert Smith, and Peaches’ “Shake Yer Dix,” and Soulwax’s “E Talking” comprises a merciless Crimson Romance, lapping at the shores of eternity.

Tiga’s smash single “Pleasure From The Bass”, a two-fisted jackal that drew a line in the dancefloor sand, was released in 2004 on the Belgian imprint PIAS.

2005 saw remixes for Depeche Mode, The Vests, Moby, LCD Soundsystem, Mylo, Phillipe Zdar, Chelonius Jones, Drama Society, Thomas Andersson and countless others. In October, Tiga womanized the world with “You Gonna Want Me”, his toothsome duet with Jake Shears (of Scissor Sisters’ fame), “Once again, I proved you can’t spell ‘sword’ without ‘words’” says the dance-freckled Disco Jockler.

2006 began with the release of Tiga’s debut album Sexor, which sounded the clarion call of an emergent Nation-Man. “It is an exhilarating time – the woes and the whoas, the thrills and the throes! Like Icarus, I have flown dangerously close to the fun, on a dare to wear my overalls undone.”
Tiga then embarked on the “Sexor over Europe” and “Sexor over Canada” tours in a manner befitting The Most Compassionate Man Alive. “Soon I will position Sexor over America and Sexor over Japan, forcing rapt smiles onto the faces of the discovantaged, those fey, oblivious costumers’ sons…”, he said.

That same year, Tiga made you go “Tig-unnggghh!” with the video for the single, “(Far From) Home.” Shot in Tokyo, the clip follows Tiga on a soul-laughening journey down a street of some sort. The video was helmed by Nagi Noda, the accalimed Japanese director of the groundbreaking music video for Yuki’s “Sentimental Journey”, a short film, Ex Fat Girl, which features exercising poodles, and projects for Nike and Laforet, for which she has won a host of prizes in Japan, not the least of which being Tiga’s coveted “Admiration-in-Japan” Medal.

Meanwhile, the “(Far From) Home” single left mankind fitted for underjeans, provocatively asking listeners “Are you a DoJ or a Don’tJ?” The release included remix work by the DFA, Digitalism, and Chicken Lips, showcasing Tiga’s incredibly exotic voice in new sonic locales, as well as a remix by Tiga himself, “The Speed of Sexor Reprise.” A well-meaning dub edit by Jon Aerosmith & Eduardo B. Rich was politely declined.

Tiga’s reign of wonder continued to not stop, as he dutifully drew up the dance contracts for tracks by Coldcut and Pet Shop Boys. “As both a student – and a significant part – of history, I feel it would be a betrayal of my stewardship to ever remix music in anger. It is not the Way of the Musician, nor is it the Musician’s Way.”


ABOUT GREEN VELVET
Change has been a constant theme throughout the successful career of Green Velvet, but as he has crossed genres, explored themes from the comedic to the serious and changed monikers, the common thread running through the music he has made for nearly two decades is its roots in and dedication to the Chicago House sound.

His first transformation came when he left master’s degree studies in chemical engineering at UC-Berkeley to turn a hobby into a career making music, influenced by the sounds he had been exposed to as a science-fiction-loving, video-game-playing kid whose father was a part-time Chicago DJ.

As Cajmere, he released his inaugural Underground Goodies EP in 1991 on his Cajual label, keeping true to the early House sound. He quickly followed it up the next year with the smash hit “Coffeepot (It’s Time for the Percolator).”

Not one to rest on his success, he soon changed things up, teaming with vocalist Dajae for “Brighter Days,” a more mellow House tune, this one released by Emotive. That pairing would be his last with a female vocalist until his recent partnership with rapper Kid Sister for “Everybody Wants.”

The 17 years in between those two projects witnessed an incredible array of electronic music emanating from this prolific artist, as well as a second label under his direction, Relief. Adopting the persona Green Velvet (not to mention a Day-Glo shock wig) for his techno-oriented pieces and DJ appearances, he became the champion of new wave Chicago beats through the ’90s-known best for hits such as “Preacher Man,” “Flash” (a No. 1 U.S. dance hit in 1995), and 1997′s laugh-inducing “Answering Machine.” The decade ended with his first album, Constant Chaos in 1999.

The new century brought a compilation album, Green Velvet, during a brief signing with Warner Bros. Records’ short-lived F-111 imprint, and a production album, Whatever, on Relief. The punk-inspired Whatever explored darker themes than his previous work, including racism (“When?”), drug use (“Genedefekt” and “La La Land”), alienation (“Sleepwalking”) and bending to authority (“Gat”).

“La La Land” went on to become by far the biggest selling track of his career. His live act expanded as he began playing a keytar, with two other musicians-Nazuk and Spaceboy-backing him, playing heavily distorted synths.

The last decade also saw Green Velvet become a fan favorite across Europe, playing to huge crowds at festivals in addition to live radio appearances and club gigs. Numerous side projects and remixes under various names also added to his seemingly nonstop musical output.
In 2005, Green Velvet released his third album, Walk In Love, which stayed true to the House sound, with a few pop- and punk-oriented tracks for good measure, including “Come Back” and “Pin-Up Girl,” both of which featured a live guitarist.

The ongoing evolution in the music, career and life of the artist born Curtis Alan Jones in Chicago has been and will continue to be fascinating to watch and experience for his many followers.

Over the past seven year’s Green Velvet has released some of his most beloved anthems, including “Shake and Pop”, “Everybody Wants”, “Milli Vanilli”. Riding the wave of critical acclaim and success, Green Velvet has been touring the globe stopping at some of the most respected clubs and festivals along way.

In addition to his solo work, he has been collaborating with some of underground dance music’s most respected and popular producers, including Maceo Plex, Jamie Jones, Danny Tenaglia, Pleasurekraft, Phil Kieran, Carl Craig, Derrick Carter, Crookers and DJ Sneak.
292016767621481.name: STUDIO 4/4: TIGA (Turbo Recordings, Montreal) & GREEN VELVET (Relief Records, Chicago)

293840120765914.description:
Chez atelier b. pour l'ouverture du festival, le premier concert de Milk & Bone. Quelle chance. Gratuit!
https://www.facebook.com/milkandbone

Milk & Bone est un duo formé de Laurence Lafond-Beaulne et Camille Poliquin. Les deux musiciennes ont acquis beaucoup d’expérience lors de leurs diverses tournées au Québec et à l’international avec plusieurs groupes (Les soeurs Boulay, David Giguère, Jason Bajada, Fanny Bloom, Alex Nevsky). Elles ont aussi prêté leurs voix en studio pour plusieurs albums (Karim Ouellet, Sébastion Lacombe, Jason Bajada, Misteur Valaire, David Giguère). Le projet Milk & Bone est né à l’été 2013 alors qu’elles collaboraient en studio avec le groupe électronique Misteur Valaire. Elles décidèrent alors de composer et enregistrer des chansons ensemble et le projet devint rapidement leur priorité. Le son de Milk & Bone est un bel équilibre entre l’électroacoustique et les instruments acoustiques, où les nombreuses harmonies vocales riches, le piano et les synthétiseurs y trouvent leur place. Le duo travaille présentement sur son premier album.

---

Milk & Bone is a duet formed by Laurence Lafond-Beaulne and Camille Poliquin. Both gained experience while touring nationally and internationally with various Quebec artists (Les Soeurs Boulay, David Giguère, Jason Bajada, Fanny Bloom, Alex Nevsky) as well as lending their voices to various studio projects (Karim Ouellet, Sébastien Lacombe, Jason Bajada, Misteur Valaire).The Milk & Bone project was created in the summer of 2013 while collaborating with electronic band Misteur Valaire. They then decided to compose and record songs together and this project quickly became their main priority. The sound of Milk & Bone evolves within an electroacoustic atmosphere accomplished through vocal harmonies as well as layers of piano and synthesizers. A beautiful mix between acoustic instruments and electronic ambiance. They are currently working on their first album.
293840120765914.name: LFSM Montréal : Milk & Bone chez atelier b.

295175347297500.description:
Chers membres et amis/es de la CCGQ,

Pour son rendez-vous mensuel de réseautage à Montréal, la CCGQ vous convie à une soirée au restaurant Les Temps Nouveaux.

Les Temps Nouveaux, c’est une initiative née de la passion et de l’épicurisme de deux amies, Nadine et Valérie, animées par l’ambition de mettre au monde un lieu de réjouissances gustatives, intellectuelles, amicales et sensuelles. 

Merveilleusement accompagnées par Pierre le Chef et tout le reste de la joyeux équipe, elles tentent de tisser la trame d’une histoire qui se veut empreinte de symphonie culinaire, de rencontres stimulantes, de détentes véritables et de découvertes heureuses. 

La cuisine des Temps Nouveaux se veut principalement instinctive et inspirée par la gastronomie française mais ne lève pas le nez sur la finesse et l’originalité des cuisines étrangères. Elle se laisse guider par le bon sens en priorisant les produits locaux, le plaisir et la simplicité. Notre leitmotiv: dorloter les papilles, chouchouter les oreilles, bichonner nos visiteurs avec chaleur et gaité.

De délicieuses bouchées vous seront gracieusement offertes et un bar payant sera à votre disposition.

Date: Le mercredi 26 Mars 2014

Où : Restaurant Les Temps Nouveaux

Heure : 6@8

Adresse : 815, boulevard de Maisonneuve Est, Montréal, H2L 1Y7

Coût : gratuit pour les membres // 10$ non-membres

Renseignements : info@ccgq.ca

En laissant votre carte d’affaires dès votre arrivée au 6@8 vous courrez la chance de gagner l'un des prix de présence offerts par nos membres et partenaires.

 Merci à nos partenaires :

Les 6@8 réseautage de la CCGQ sont rendus possibles grâce à la contribution de notre partenaire majeur TD
295175347297500.name: 6@8 CCGQ Montréal. Restaurant Les Temps Nouveaux. Le mercredi 26 Mars 2014

295361223946596.description:
Patch Adams, le célèbre médecin précurseur au concours du rire en milieu médical, vient à Montréal pour une semaine d'activités clownesques et de rencontres foulosophiques !

Conférences,  flashmob, souper-bénéfice, cabaret, projection du film biographique, visite de centres hospitaliers, partie de hockey en fauteuils roulants, rencontre de personnes en situation d’itinérance... Un programme riche et haut en couleur, orchestré pour le 15e Symfolium de Foulosophie. 

Véritable icone dans le monde de la médecine, Patch Adams estime que c’est par l’amour et la compassion autant que par la médecine dite conventionnelle qu’il convient d’apporter du soin aux personnes malades. 
Venez découvrir son univers et sa mission lors du Joy of Caring, conférence animée par Patch lui-même : 

- 31 mars | 19h30 - Conférence Joy of Caring @ Théâtre Maisonneuve 
https://billetterie.placedesarts.com/evtarifs.aspx?owner=123&event=12438&language=FR 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Il sera également présent et participera entre autres aux événements suivants : 

- 28 mars | 11h - Conférence de presse @Théâtre Saint-James, remise de médailles

- 28 mars | 12h - Tournée à bord d’idAction Mobile, la caravane philosophique d’Exeko
http://exeko.org/idaction-mobile 

- 28 mars | 18h30 - Projection du film Patch Adams @ Cinéma du Parc
http://www.cinemaduparc.com/prochainement.php?id=patchadams#top 

- 30 mars | 14h - Flashmob @ Espace culturel Georges-Émile-Lapalme 
http://www.pda.qc.ca/salles/quadrilatere/espace-culturel-georges-emile-lapalme.fr.html 

-  1er avril | 13h - Partie de hockey en fauteuil roulant @ École Joseph-Charbonneau
http://joseph-charbonneau.csdm.ca/activites/blitz/ 

-  1er avril | 20h - Cabaret Hommage à Patch Adams @ Théâtre le Rialto
http://www.theatrerialto.ca/en/programmation/comedy/5-402-the-real-patch-adams.html 

Retrouvez toute la programmation sur www.udfou.com 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Le 15e Symfolium est un événement rassembleur faisant partie de la campagne de financement UNIS pour le Phare,  co-organisé par l’Université de Foulosophie, Exeko et Publicité Sauvage, en collaboration avec Jovia et le Phare, Enfants et Familles. L’intégralité des bénéfices seront redistribués au Phare, Enfants et Familles, à Exeko, au Symfolium ainsi qu’à l’Institut Gesundheit.
https://www.unispourlephare.com/evenement-222-docteur-patch-adams-a-montreal--symfolium.html 

Exeko est un organisme de bienfaisance dont la mission est de favoriser, par l’innovation en culture et en éducation, l’inclusion et le développement des populations les plus marginalisées.
http://exeko.org/ 

L’Université de foulosophie a pour mission de célébrer et de répandre l’humour engagé, la folie créatrice et la folle sagesse, celle qui libère et rend heureux.
http://www.udfou.com/ 

Jovia a pour mission de contribuer à l’amélioration de la qualité de vie des personnes hospitalisées par ses programmes de clowns thérapeutiques alliant la complicité, le jeu et l’imaginaire.
http://www.jovia.ca/ 

Le Phare Enfants et Familles est un organisme sans but lucratif créé pour contribuer au bien-être des enfants dont la vie est menacée par une maladie nécessitant des soins complexes et apporter répit et soutien gratuitement à leurs familles.
http://www.phare-lighthouse.com/ 

Publicité Sauvage  a pour mission première d’offrir une visibilité efficace et percutante à moindre coût aux organismes et événements culturels.
http://www.publicitesauvage.com/
295361223946596.name: PATCH ADAMS À MONTRÉAL

296984807116701.description:
Jeudi le 20 mars prochain, à compter de 20h30, nous inaugurons l’arrivée de la nouvelle saison chez Baila Con Gusto - Montreal, avec notre « Soirée de l’équinoxe du printemps »! C’est en ce jour durant le voyage annuel de la terre autour du soleil est celle où le jour et la nuit sont de la même longueur, avant que la lumière du soleil commence enfin à dominer sur la noirceur de l’hiver. Comme notre hiver est particulièrement têtu cette année, il fera sans doute encore froid ce jeudi, mais qu’importe! Sortez les belles couleurs vives de votre garde-robe et venez accueillir le printemps en dansant avec nous! 

Pour souligner notre enthousiasme à l’arrivée de la belle saison, Baila Con Gusto est heureux de ramener son concours des « 100 premiers invités ». Les 100 premiers invités qui confirmeront leur présence sur la page Facebook de l’événement courront la chance de gagner une passe GRATUITE pour la soirée « Salsa Fever Competition ». WOW quelle chance!

Comme d’habitude, vous serez gâtés du côté du menu musical : Dans la salle de salsa DJ-Sabrusso Montreal, notre étoile montante, ne vous permettra pas de vous asseoir un instant. Vous ne pourrez vous empêcher de danser! Dans la salle de bachata, DJ Jean Nonez, la référence de la bachata à Montréal, amplifiera la passion avec ses torrides sélections musicales.

Et pour bien vous dégourdir avant la soirée, l’incontournable classe de bachata de Renaud Ayotte et América R-a dAlma Latina Montréal, de 20h30 à 21h30. 

Venez vous joindre à nous et célébrer l’arrivée de l’équinoxe du printemps chez Baila Con Gusto Espaces Des Arts au 9 Sainte-Catherine est, 2ème étage) 

*Entrée: 6$ **Vestiaire: 2$.

************
Thursday March 20th, as of 8:30 p.m., Baila Con Gusto is inaugurating the arrival of a new season with its “Spring Equinox” night. On this day during the earth’s annual voyage around the sun, the day and night are of same length; afterwards, the days start to get longer, finally overthrowing dominance of darkness. Since this winter has been particularly stubborn, it may still be cold come Thursday, but who cares? Grab something colourful from your closet and come greet spring by dancing with us! 

To emphasize our enthusiasm at the new season’s arrival, we’re happy to bring back the “First 100 confirmed” contest! The first 100 guests who confirm their presence on our event’s Facebook page could win a FREE pass to “Salsa Fever Competition”. How amazing is that?! 

As always, you’ll be spoiled by our musical menu: In our salsa room, our rising star, DJ Sabrusso won’t let you sit down for a minute; you won’t have a choice but to dance the night away. In our bachata room, DJ Jean Nonez, the bachata reference in Montreal, will rev up the spring passion with his hottest musical selections. 

And to warm up properly before the evening, Renaud Ayotte and America’s bachata class from 8:30 to 9:30 is a MUST! 

Come join us and celebrate the arrival of the spring equinox at Baila Con Gusto (Espace des Arts, at 9 Ste-Catherine Street East, 2nd floor).

*Entrance fee: 6$ **Coat check: 2$
296984807116701.name: Baila Con Gusto *Montréal* - Soirée de l'équinoxe du printemps

Après une trop longue absence suite à la sortie de l’album Hexes For Exes, le groupe pionnier de dance-punk : Moving Units revient avec Neurotic Exotic. Le groupe vient de réaliser un nouvel album qui embrasse toutes les influences : de la pop à la dance, au dark rock alternatif, en passant par la funk, le hip-hop ou la techno modern. La chanson d’ouverture “Attack Everything” à la tonalité électro, puis la teinte disco du titre  “Everybody Loves a Star”, les nuances de guitares plutôt modérées dans  “Dark Side of the Room”, et le texte étonnement introspectif de la chanson  “Kate Moss in '97”, Neurotic Exotic nous fait découvrir Moving Units dans sa plus grande diversité, tout en conservant le style musical qui leur est propre.
________________

After a much-too-long hiatus post- Hexes For Exes, Los Angeles based dance-punk pioneers Moving Units return with Neurotic Exotic. Featuring the band’s signature dance-punk swagger, the new album sees Moving Units embrace all elements of influence, from dance and pop to dark alternative rock, funk, hip hop rhythms and modern techno and more. From the electronica shimmer opening of “Attack Everything” and the disco-tinged swagger of “Everybody Loves a Star” , the more sedate guitar nuances of “Dark Side of the Room”, and the surprisingly personally introspective lyrics of “Kate Moss in '97”, Neurotic Exotic shows Moving Units at its most diverse, while maintaining the signature sound it has always been known for.

www.movingunits.net


***************************************************

INDIE MONTRÉAL

www.indiemontreal.ca

http://twitter.com/indiemontreal

Group: 'Montreal Indie Music Network' on Facebook

299724453513134.description:
APPEL 

Nous citoyens algériens, appelons les algériennes et algériens à faire barrage au régime corrompu qui a pris l'Algérie en otage depuis 1962. Et construire ensemble l'avenir de notre pays, une ALGÉRIE MODERNE DÉMOCRATIQUE ET SOCIALE

Nous devons constituer aujourd'hui et plus que jamais un réel rapport de force populaire contre la mafia politico-militaro-financière et faire barrage aux BOUTEFLIKAS et aussi et SURTOUT à ceux qui l'ont ramené et imposé en 1999 en 2004, et en 2009 et qui essayent aujourd'hui de se cacher derrière son personnage.

Pour cela, nous appelons tous les citoyens algériens à rejoindre l'action citoyenne du Samedi 22  Mars à Paris pour une MARCHE HISTORIQUE qui regroupera tous les algériens soucieux de l'avenir de leur pays.

Nous exigeons :

-La dissolution de la POLICE POLITIQUE. -Le départ des BOUTEFLIKAS.

"Djazayer Horra Dimocratiya"

300290633460370.description:
Le Projet Retailles est une collaboration créative qui jumelle 7090 avec trois compositeurs du Québec et quatre des Pays-Bas, d’une façon novatrice. Les sept compositeurs participants ont été invités à partager leurs « retailles » – c’est-à-dire les brouillons et les esquisses qui ont été abandonnées ou inutilisées au fil des années – avec les interprètes, qui les arrangeront de façon créative pour créer un concert à partir de ces divers fragments. Les compositeurs travailleront avec 7090 sous le conseil de Christopher Butterfield durant la semaine qui précèdera le concert, afin de préparer cette collaboration excentrique.

Mettant en vedette les retailles de :
Adam Basanta (Montréal)
Noriko Koide (Japon/Pays-Bas)
Thanasis Deligiannis (Grèce/Pays-Bas)
Gabriel Dharmoo (Montréal)
Grzegorz Marciniak (Polonge/Pays-Bas)
Christopher Reiche (Victoria, C-B)
Bart de Vrees (Pays-Bas)

Billets 15 $ régulier, 10 $ étudiants/ainés/artistes

Plus d'infos : http://innovationsenconcert.ca/event/2014-fragments/?lang=fr

Cette résidence de création est rendue possible grâce au Matralab.

-------

Projet Retailles is a creative collaboration pairing 7090 with three composers from Canada and four from the Netherlands in an innovative fashion. The seven participating composers have been invited to share their “leftovers” – composition scraps that have been discarded or unused over the years – with the performers, who will then work creatively to create a concert out of these various fragments. The composers will work together with 7090 under the mentorship of Christopher Butterfield for a week preceding the concert in preparation for this eccentric collaboration.

Featuring the leftovers of:
Adam Basanta (Montreal)
Noriko Koide (Japan-Netherlands)
Thanasis Deligiannis (Greece-Netherlands)
Gabriel Dharmoo (Montreal)
Grzegorz Marciniak (Poland-Netherlands)
Christopher Reiche (Victoria, BC)
Bart de Vrees (Netherlands)

Tickets $15 regular, $10 students/seniors/artists

More info: http://innovationsenconcert.ca/event/2014-fragments/?lang=en

This creative residency is made possible by the support of Matralab.
300290633460370.location: Édifice Gaston-Miron (CAM), 1210, rue Sherbrooke Est, Montréal
300290633460370.name: Gaudeamus-Montreal III : 7090 présente le Projet Retailles / Leftovers Project

300398436782550.description:
Après près de 4 ans comme sideman pour Aidan Knight (côtoyant la scène avec Karkwa, Hannah Georgas, et Hey Ocean), et collaborant en studio et en concert avec Louis-Jean Cormier, Dan Mangan, Said the Whale, et Les Monstres Terribles, Olivier Clements débutera pour la toute première fois son groupe Dissonant Histories le 24 mai au Cagibi (9pm).

Dissonant Histories est un octet qui déchiffre une collision audacieuse entre le jazz, le hip-hop, l'indie-rock et la music classique.  Après avoir lancer leur premier album en février, le groupe sera en tournée dans l'Ontario et le Québec en mai.

/////

After almost 4 years of touring with Aidan Knight  (opening for Karkwa, Hannah Georgas and Hey Ocean), sharing the stage and recording with artist like Louis-Jean Cormier, Dan Mangan, Said the Whale, and Northcote, Olivier Clements presents his group Dissonant Histories with their new album May 24th at Le Cagibi (9pm)

Dissonant Histories is an octet that recklessly collides jazz with hip-hop, indie rock and classical music.  The ensemble released their début album last February and will be touring for the very first time Ontario and Québec in May.



Featuring: Ryan Brouwer (flugelhorn), Anders Azzopardi (trombone), Nathan Dell-Vandenberg (trombone), Anthony Rinaldi (bass clarinet), Will Fisher (drums), Matt Giffin (keys), Søren Nissen (bass).

Live @ le Cagibi
Samedi, 24 Mai
les portes ouvrent à 20h30, la musique commence à 21h00
5490 Blvd St-Laurent.
10$

VIDEO SUBMISSIONS ARE BEING ACCEPTED NOW!!
DEADLINE: February 28th, 2014

Hosted by: Mel Charlot & DCP (www.melcharlot.com)

Motivating Excellence takes pride in being the first professional dance-training program that is geared for the commercial dancer. Created by Artistic Director/ Choreographer Rhapsody James, M.E. provides students with the skills and knowledge to become the ultimate commercial dancer in the entertainment industry. Through intense class training and professional seminars, M.E. is dedicated to defining the discipline in commercial dance. We offer classes in Street Jazz, Hip Hop, Performance, Staging Techniques, Partnering, Props, Image Consulting, Audition Techniques and more. Pushing you to your highest potential, this intimate ONE WEEK Intensive will give you just a taste of what the OFFICIAL Motivating Excellence  Training Program is all about.

VIDEO SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS:

NOTE: ONLY 24 Participants will be selected. Selectees will be notified by  MARCH 3rd.

-You MUST be 18 & Up to submit.
-Please submit a video no longer than 2min of yourself performing a choreographed routine and a freestyle. Please be sure to tell us your name, contact information as well as brief verbal summary of why you should be selected for this intensive

-Please send your video submissions to info@motivatingexcellenceonline.com. If you decide to send a private video link, please remember to include the password in your submission email.
*only .mov and mp.4 formats accepted.

M.E. WEEK INTENSIVE DETAILS:
- Up to 6 hours of training per day with Rhapsody James
-Exclusive Audition Motivating Excellence Summer Intensive in NYC (Scholarships will be given away for M.E. and more)
-Exclusive M.E. Intensive Closing Performance for family and friends

FOR MORE INFO : WWW.MOTIVATINGEXCELLENCEONLINE.COM

309407945877483.description:
Diego Espinosa, multipercussionniste et artiste sonore primé, présente des œuvres qui mettent de l’avant des instruments personnalisés et novateurs issus de ses collaborations avec des compositeurs à Amsterdam, La Haye, Berlin, New York, Montréal, Morelia et Mexico.

Espinosa s’est produit sur les cinq continents en collaborant avec des compositeurs comme Pierre Boulez, John Zorn, Steve Reich, John Luther Adams, Kajia Saariaho, Peter Eötvös, Frederic Rzewski et Alvin Curran. Il a récemment reçu le Grand Prix de l’interprétation du Festival expérimental de Tokyo vol. 8 (2013) pour son œuvre de collaboration avec le compositeur Hugo Morales, présentée ce soir. En plus de ses nombreux prix et mentions à l’échelle internationale, il a remporté le deuxième prix du Concours international des interprètes de Gaudeamus 2009.

Programme: 
-David Adamcyk (Canada / New York) et Diego Espinosa : Six Drawings by Randall (2012)
-Felipe Waller (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : Techua (2012, révisé 2014)
-Jasna Velickovic (Serbie / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : sUn (2013, révisé 2014)
-Juan Sebastian Lach (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : Guajex (2013)
-Hugo Morales (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : 150pf for body capacitance (2013, révisé 2014)

Billets 15 $ régulier, 10 $ étudiants/ainés/artistes

Plus d'infos : http://innovationsenconcert.ca/event/2014-espinosa/?lang=fr

----

Diego Espinosa, award winning multi-percussionist/sound artist, presents works using innovative custom instruments derived from collaborations with composers in Amsterdam, the Hague, Berlin, New York, Montreal, Morelia and Mexico City.

Espinosa has performed on all five continents collaborating with composers such as Pierre Boulez, John Zorn, Steve Reich, John Luther Adams, Kajia Saariaho, Peter Eötvös, Frederic Rzewski and Alvin Curran. Recently he received the Performance Grand Prize of the Tokyo Experimental Festival Vol.8 (2013) for his collaborative work with composer Hugo Morales, featured this evening. In addition to his multiple awards and acknowledgements worldwide, he received 2nd Prize in the International Gaudeamus Interpreters Competition 2009.

Program:
-David Adamcyk (Canada / New York) et Diego Espinosa : Six Drawings by Randall (2012)
-Felipe Waller (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : Techua (2012, révisé 2014)
-Jasna Velickovic (Serbie / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : sUn (2013, révisé 2014)
-Juan Sebastian Lach (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : Guajex (2013)
-Hugo Morales (Mexique / Pays-Bas) et Diego Espinosa : 150pf for body capacitance (2013, révisé 2014)

Tickets $15 regular, $10 students/seniors/artists

More info: http://innovationsenconcert.ca/event/2014-espinosa/?lang=en

Artists in attendance/Artistes présents: Raymonde April, Evergon, Isabelle Hayeur, Denis Lessard, Aislinn Leggett,  Marisa Portolese, Alain Pratte, Gabor Szilasi with editor / avec l'éditeur  Ho Tam

Open to public – Free admission
Ouvert au public - admission gratuite

Frontline is an interview book on 17 Canadian photo-based artists/art groups. Written in Chinese and released in China, it presents a manifesto made up of many voices in our photographic community. 

Frontline est un livre d’entrevues avec 17 artistes/groupes canadiens travaillant avec la photographie. Écrit en chinois et publié en Chine, le livre présente un manifeste créé par plusieurs voix de notre communauté photographique.

As the Chinese economy continues to grow and the country looks to the world for ideas, there has been a surge of interest in photography along with escalating sales in cameras. Frontline is therefore a timely publication introducing the Canadian artists and their diverse practices to the Chinese audience and readers. As techniques and practices continue to change and evolve, in a century dominated by image making, Frontline also takes stock of the current state of photo-based art production. 

Avec l’économie chinoise qui continue de grandir, la Chine se tourne vers les autres pays du monde afin de trouver de nouvelles idées. Il y a un accroissement de l’intérêt pour la photographie et des augmentations de vente d’appareils photo. Frontline est donc une publication opportune qui présente des artistes canadiens et leurs pratiques diverses à un public chinois. Avec des techniques et pratiques qui continuent de changer et d’évoluer, dans un siècle dominé par la création de l’image, Frontline démontre aussi les nouvelles tendances de la production en art photographique.

The 17 artists in Frontline represent a wide range of background and approach in using photography. They range from traditional documentary photographers to artists who do not even use a camera in their work. Many artists are Montreal-based, including Raymonde April, Nicolas Baier, Evergon, Isabelle Hayeur, Aislinn Leggett, Marisa Portolese, Alain Pratte and Gabor Szilasi. 

Les 17 artistes de Frontline ont différentes formations et représentent diverses approches d’utilisation de la photographie. Les styles varient de la photographie documentaire traditionnelle aux photographes qui travaillent sans caméra. Plusieurs artistes sont de Montréal, dont Raymonde April, Nicolas Baier, Evergon, Isabelle Hayeur, Aislinn Leggett, Marisa Portolese, Alain Pratte et Gabor Szilasi.
 
Frontline (前线) is written (in Chinese) and edited by Ho Tam, published by Beijing Modern Press (北京现代出版社). The book has 244 pages and is printed in full colour with over 200 illustrations of works. 

Frontline (前线) est rédigé en chinois, édité par Ho Tam, et publié par Beijing Modern Press (北京现代出版社). Le livre de 244 pages est imprimé en couleurs, avec plus de 200 reproductions d’œuvres.

To coincide with the launching of Frontline, Ho Tam will also introduce books from two other publication projects -- 88Books and XXX.

Jumelé avec le lancement de Frontline, Ho Tam propose également des livres provenant de deux autres projets de publications -- 88Books et XXX.

88Books is a series featuring work by emerging artists from China.  Committed to represent new voices from the younger generation, the series provides autonomy and freedom of expression to the participating artists and aims to foster the production of artist’s books, a relatively new concept in China. 

88Books est une série qui présente le travail d’artistes émergents de Chine. Consacrée à la représentation des nouvelles voix d’une jeune génération, la série donne de l’autonomie et de la liberté d’expression aux artistes participants et vise à promouvoir la production de livres d’artistes, un concept relativement nouveau en Chine.

XXX is a newly published series of queer zines by Canadian and international artists. 
Each issue comes in a limited edition of 100, all printed and hand bound in Canada.  The participating artists include Evergon, Denis Lessard, Micah Lexier and Dennis Day.

XXX est une nouvelle série de zines queer par des artistes canadiens et internationaux. Chaque publication est une édition limitée à 100 exemplaires, faite à la main au Canada. Parmi les artistes participants, on retrouve Evergon, Denis Lessard, Micah Lexier et Dennis Day.

***************************

《前线－国际当代摄影艺术家访谈》是一本由与17位加拿大当代摄影艺术家的对话组合而成的实录。通过与艺术家的对话，揭示他们摄影艺术创作的理念，介绍他们幕后创作的现场和故事，探讨他们进行艺术创作的各种实践及当代摄影艺术的概貌。全书用中文撰写，最近刚在中国推出。
随着中国经济的持续增长和国家开放，国内正出现了一股对摄影的热潮，相机销售高升。因此，《前线》正及时向中国观众介绍加拿大的摄影艺术家。由于技术和实践的不断变化和发展，前线正好为国内的摄影师和爱好者提供了艺术历史，创作概念和基础知识, 另一方面, 《前线》也为加中的文化和友好交流作出小贡献。
书中的17艺术家代表广泛的年龄，背景，教育，职业和摄影手法。包括从传统的纪实摄影师，到甚至不使用相机的艺术家。其中多位是大学教授和导师,以及资深的艺术家.

evenko et Live Nation Global Touring sont fiers de présenter Justin Timberlake au Centre Bell le 31 octobre et le 1er novembre prochain! 

À la demande générale, un des plus grands artistes de notre génération, Justin Timberlake, annonce un second spectacle à Montréal dans le cadre de sa tournée The 20/20 Experience World Tour le 1er novembre prochain. Après avoir dominé les palmarès avec la sortie de The 20/20 Experience, Timberlake présentera son énergique spectacle à ses fans à travers le monde jusqu’en 2014. Sa première tournée en 6 ans visitera plusieurs pays à travers l’Amérique du nord, l’Europe, l’Amérique du sud et l’Australie.
 
The 20/20 Experience World Tour est présentée à travers le monde par Live Nation Global Touring. Justin a aussi annoncé aujourd’hui que le périple musical amorcé avec The 20/20 Experience se poursuivra avec la sortie d’un nouvel album le 30 septembre prochain. Les billets pour le deuxième spectacle au Centre Bell seront en vente le 24 mai à 10h via evenko.ca .
 
Les membres du tout nouveau fan club de Justin Timberlake, The Tennessee Kids ( #TNKids) auront accès à une prévente le 21 mai mai à 10h. Les fans peuvent visiter www.justintimberlake.com/tennesseekids pour devenir membre et recevoir un code pour avoir accès à la prévente.
 
The 20/20 Experience est déjà, selon plusieurs critiques, un des meilleurs albums de l’année. L’album aura droit à sa suite le 30 septembre prochain. Écrit et produit par Justin, cet album contiendra 10 nouvelles chansons qui explorent les barrières musicales que les fans ont découvertes dans le précédent album.
 
Ne manquez pas Justin Timberlake au Centre Bell le 31 octobre et 1er novembre prochain!
 
Pour plus d’information visitez www.justintimberlake.com ou www.livenation.com.  Hashtag:  #JT2020TOUR

evenko and Live Nation Global Touring are proud to present Justin Timberlake at the Bell Centre on October 31st and November 1st.  

Due to overwhelming demand, one of this generation’s most-celebrated entertainers, Justin Timberlake,  announced today a second show in Montreal for The 20/20 Experience World Tour at Bell Centre on November 1st. After dominating the global charts with the release of his acclaimed new album, The 20/20 Experience, Timberlake will bring his electrifying live shows to fans with a worldwide tour that will run through 2014.  The Grammy® and Emmy® Award-winning artist’s first tour in six years will visit dozens of countries throughout North America, Europe, South America and Australia. 
The 20/20 Experience World Tour is promoted worldwide by Live Nation Global Touring.  Justin also revealed today the musical journey started on The 20/20 Experience will continue with the worldwide release of the new album on September 30, 2013. Tickets for the second show at Bell Centre go on-sale Friday, May 24th 10am at evenko.ca.
 
The 20/20 Experience World Tour will kick off in North America starting on October 31 in Montreal, Quebec at the Bell Centre with dates lined up for Las Vegas, Dallas, Houston, Phoenix, Atlanta and more. Justin Timberlake’s all-new fan club, The Tennessee Kids (#TNKids), will have access to a pre-sale starting on May 21st at 10 AM local time.  Fans should visit www.justintimberlake.com/tennesseekids to register for the fan club and receive a special code to access the pre-sale.  
 
The 20/20 Experience, already hailed by critics as one of the year’s best albums, will continue with a second worldwide release this year on September 30.  Written and produced by Justin, the epic album will feature 10 all new songs that explore the sonic boundaries fans discovered with the music found on this year’s earlier release. 
 
Don’t miss Justin Timberlake at the Bell Centre on October 31st and November 1st! 
 
For more information please visit www.justintimberlake.com or www.livenation.com.  Hashtag:  #JT2020TOUR

353173471491444.description:
Love is not a mood, but a dynamic way of being. - Gabrielle Roth                                             

pour la traduction française, faites défiler vers la bas

The spontaneous heart is one that knows how to love and be loved. The Heartbeat map is a guide to how our emotional energy moves and morphs. In this practice we embody the art of being a fluid emotional athlete. This map teaches us how to navigate the emotional terrain of life without getting stuck, holding on, or pushing away.

We will explore how the body has been shaped by our emotions and we will learn to track when the heart is open and when it is closed. As waves of feeling move through us, we learn how to trust the dance to lead us in a healthy and creative way. Through the embodiment of this practice, you will be shown skills to take home and use in your daily life. This workshop is designed for everyone, of every age, and shape. No experience is required. All workshop hours contribute to 5Rhythms® teacher training prerequisites.

Recommended reading: Roth, Sweat Your Prayers, Maps to Ecstasy, and Connections.

http://www.luciahoran.com/five-rhythms/

L’amour n’est pas une humeur mais plutôt le dynamisme de notre être.
                                               - Gabrielle Roth


Un coeur spontané sait aimer et être aimé. 
Le schéma de l’atelier “Coup de Coeur” nous dévoile notre énergie émotionnelle en transition et en mouvement. Nous incarnons l’art d’être un athlète émotionnel fluide avec cette pratique, et nous apprenons comment naviguer les eaux tumultueuses de notre vie émotionnelle sans sombrer, s’acharner, ou s’éloigner.
Nous explorerons comment les émotions affectent nos corps. Nous apprendrons comment reconnaître quand le coeur est ouvert et quand il est fermé, et comment faire confiance à la danse d’une façon saine et créative lorsque les vagues d’émotion surgissent en nous. 
Nous verrons aussi comment incorporer cette pratique dans notre vie de tous les jours.
Cet atelier est conçu pour tous, qu’importe l’âge ou la forme physique. 
Aucune expérience préalable n’est requise.
Cet atelier contribue aux heures requises pour le programme d’enseignant des 5Rythmes.
Lecture suggérée: Gabrielle Roth: "Sweat Your Prayers", "Maps to Ecstasy," et "Connect
http://www.luciahoran.com/five-rhythms/

367568206660928.description:
Dear IPTN Members,
We are very happy to announce that the 2015 IPTN World Conference will be in Montréal, Canada. The IPTN Board very much appreciates the energy and generosity being put into this event by the conference organisers!

Some of you might remember that originally we had a proposal from Playback Theatre North America to host 2015 Conference. During the process we realised that the United States might be inaccessible for IPTN members from many different countries. Of course we want to make the conference as accessible as possible. Playback Theatre North America fully supports the Canadian proposal.

As with Frankfurt, the Montréal conference will be organised by a team made up of members from different playback companies. The Montreal Conference Organizing Committee (MCOC) will be in touch soon with more information on the conference and various ways that Playbackers and friends of Playback Theatre can contribute to what promises to be a very memorable event!
367568206660928.name: IPTN World Conference 2015 in Montréal, Canada

386595358153691.description:
For over a decade now - first in Paris, then Montreal and now in Berlin- La Fraicheur has been brewing her own blend of Synthetic Acid Psyche Deep Tech House Beats sprinkled with Tropical Booty Soul Hip Pop TRap & B sounds when the mood strikes her. It don't mean a thing, yet she got that swing! Like a shaker she smoothes it all down for your ass to dance to and your heart to melt on.

Marathon jukebox girl part of the Leonizer Record crew, she can go on for countless hours, running the gamut from 60's classic to this new song that got released 2 hours ago, sparkling it with surprise toppings of all sorts.

Best Fro'Yo you'll ever have.

Every other week, her radioshow Berlin Calling is broadcasted on French Radio Campus Grenoble 90.8FM and the podcasts online. Every other trip back home, you can listen to her on CKUT 90.3FM Montreal.

La Fraicheur has played alongside: Justice, Yuksek, Vicarious Bliss, Leonard de Leonard, Casiotone for the Painfully Alone, Siskid, Trust, Lauren Flax, Hannah Holland, Guido (Acid Arab), Mattle Safer (The Rapture), Feadz, Chris de Luca (Funkstörung), Alex Monster, Sarah Adorable (Scream Club), Transformer di Roboter, Ada, Lady Sovereign, Crookers, Ddamage, DatA, Brodinski, Bobmo, Orgasmic, Tekilatex, We Are Enfant Terrible, Perfect Loosers, Crame, Dee Nasty, Rodeo, Gachette Of The Mastiff, Naive New Beaters, Sweetlight, Siskid, Nark, Riff Raff, Eat Tapes, Randy Twigg, Finger On The Pulse, Broadzillas DJs, Claek, Club Bizarre, AZF and more.

La Fraicheur has played in Paris, Berlin, Montreal, New York, Philadelphia, Seattle, Portland, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Olympia, Lausanne, Ljubljana, Riga, Marseille, Lille, Nantes, Grenoble, Neuchatel…

397667003711604.description:
Ca c'est notre planning pour cette année. / Itinerary for this year.

Jeudi 25 Septembre: Nous quittons Montréal à 3am et arrivons à Ocean City à 3pm. Nous faisons le check in et allons à la plage question de relaxer après une longue route de 12h

Vendredi 26 Septembre: Nous passons la matinée à la plage et dès 12h les rassemblements commencent. Il y a des rassemblements dans tous les stationnements sur l'île ça en est ridicule je vous jure le "coastal highway" est remplis de voitures plus incroyables les unes que les autres

Samedi 27 Septembre: À notre réveil, difficile du la grosse nuit que nous venons de passer, et allons au BBQ H20i sans heures précises. Le BBQ (9am - 5pm) est un gros rassemblement au camping ou il y a le h2oi puis nous repartons pour une nuit endiablée. (l'an dernier nous avons quitter les rassemblements a 4am pour se baigner dans l'océan vers 5am)

Dimanche 28 Septembre: Nous quittons l'hotel le plus tôt possible (8am est le mieux) puisque c'est l'exposition! Le h2oi se termine à 5pm sur quoi nous retournerons à l'hotel pour décompresser de cette éprouvante fin de semaine et faire nos bagages.

Lundi 29 Septembre: Vous pouvez partir à l'heure qui vous chante le "check out" est a 11am pour notre part vers 7am nius quittons en direction de New York City et quittons aux alentours de 6pm pour être a Montréal vers minuit.

http://www.h2ointernational.com/

Holiday Inn
6600 coastal hwy
Ocean city, MD
http://www.holidayinnoceanfront.com/



English:

Thursday 25th September: We leave at Montreal at 3:00am and arrive at Ocean City for 3:00pm. Check in at our respective hotels and check out the scene and the beach, then relax until midnight. 

Friday 26th September : Wake up and go to the beach. The meets start up at noon in every parking lot on the Coast Highway!

Saturday 27th September: We sleep in from all the partying until 4:00am, then we head to the H20i BBQ (9am -5am). Then the party starts again!

Sunday 28th September: The show is on from 8am to 5pm, after we relax and pack our stuff. We all head to the beach and take it easy.

Monday 29th September: Check out is at 11am. We meet up and wash our cars, and leave for 7:00am towards New York and arrive at 6pm, Home sweet home by midnight!
397667003711604.name: Official H2Oi Rush: Montreal - Ocean City

402664719865671.description:
ARE YOU A PHOTOGRAPHER OR PHOTOGRAPHY ENTHUSIAST?

PICTURAMA wants your photos for a collective art show happening MARCH 1st! 

Sift through your old shoeboxes, photo albums, SD cards, cookie tins, and even cell phones and print anywhere from 2-10 of your all time fave photographs. We’ll display them for the whole world to see and sell them for $2 each with $1 going right back to you, the artist.

!! HOW TO PARTICIPATE !!

1. SUBMIT an envelope containing a maximum of TEN 4x6 or 4x4 photographs to Kafein Café Bar (1429 Rue Bishop). 

2. LABEL the envelope with your name, e-mail address and phone number and the number of photos inside. Any subject, any date, any format camera. Yes, this means you can drop off your favourite Instagrams!

3. WRITE your name and whatever else you want your buyer to know on the back of each photo you submit, but make sure not to let it press through and ruin your beautiful artwork. 

4. DELIVER your photos to KAFEIN CAFÉ BAR (1429 Rue Bishop) by Wednesday, February 26th at the latest.

*****

!! ADDITIONAL INFO !! 

- Make sure to print all photos on PHOTO paper. Photos printed on regular paper will not be displayed. 

- Please only submit YOUR OWN photos. Taking creds and profiting from other people’s work is just not cool.

- PICTURAMA is a free-for-all no theme event, but photos considered offensive by the organizers, will not be displayed.

- Even if you’re not a participating photographer, come to the event to check out the art, meet the artists and enjoy some drinks with friends!

*****

PICTURAMA! 1st time in MTL
Saturday, March 1st // 7pm to 11pm

$2 Cover
No Cover if you're participating. 

Tell your friends!

Kafein Café Bar
1429 Rue Bishop

408149899320880.description:
One of Montreal's least known neighbourhoods but the one that most resembles a village within an urban setting. A multicultural neighbourhood filled with charm, great parks, family activities. People stop to chat daily with lots of baby strollers... Filled with Montreal designers, bakeries, chocolate makers, well known pastry shops, several  bars, neighbhourhood lunch and dinner spots, one of the best coffee spots in Montreal.On the cusp of  North America's largest year round food market. A mecca for foodies to Jarry Park known for international Roger's Tennis. 

The tour will zigzag through the neighbourhood where you will see the variety of homes, speciality shops and restaurants. Hear about the Jean Talon Market importance in the neighbhourhood and to the residences.
You will get to meet some of the locals who live and work in neighbourhood. A unique off the beaten track tour of a great Montreal neighbourhood.... 


Your guide Ruby lives in the neighbourhood, That too, since the age of 10 years old in the same house she has grown up in.. Ruby is a Montreal Expert & a Certified Licensed Montreal Professional Guide by the city of Montreal.
Thus legally allowed to offer guides tours.. She specialises in Montreal's neighbourhoods, Hidden Gems, Culinary and biking tours and off the beaten track tours.
She is a veteran guide, who is , passionate about Montreal and has been guiding since 1992. 
Ruby focuses on having you discover all things Montreal, encouraging local businesses, local establishments, artists, activities while ensuring.
Her tours are raw, unspoiled, authentic and unique while respecting the environment.


For more information please visit linkedIn to see Ruby's profile

The tour will begin at one of the Métro Stations in the neighbourhood ( To be confirmed once payment has been received for the tour)

Maxium:  15 people

Confirmation with full payment of tour before March 14th

THE 20/20 EXPERIENCE WORLD TOUR

BILLETS EN VENTE LUNDI 13 MAI À 10 HEURES!
Billets en vente aux guichets du Centre Bell
Par téléphone: 1 855 310-2525
Commandez en ligne: www.evenko.ca
Billet :  63$ à 192,50$ (taxes et frais de service inclus)


evenko et Live Nation Global Touring sont fiers de présenter Justin Timberlake au Centre Bell le 31 octobre prochain. 

Un des plus grands artistes de notre génération, Justin Timberlake, annonce aujourd’hui sa tournée The 20/20 Experience World Tour qui débutera ici-même à Montréal le 31 octobre. Après avoir dominé les palmarès avec la sortie de The 20/20 Experience, Timberlake présentera son énergique spectacle à ses fans à travers le monde jusqu’en 2014. Sa première tournée en 6 ans visitera plusieurs pays à travers l’Amérique du nord, l’Europe, l’Amérique du sud et l’Australie.

The 20/20 Experience World Tour est présentée à travers le monde par Live Nation Global Touring. Justin a aussi annoncé aujourd’hui que le périple musical amorcé avec The 20/20 Experience se poursuivra avec la sortie d’un nouvel album le 30 septembre prochain.
 
Le 20/20 Experience World Tour débutera à Montréal au Centre Bell le 31 octobre. Les billets seront en vente le lundi 13 mai à 10h. Les membres du tout nouveau fan club de Justin Timberlake, The Tennessee Kids ( #TNKids) auront accès à une prévente le 7 mai à 10h. Les fans peuvent visiter www.justintimberlake.com/tennesseekids pour devenir membre et recevoir un code pour avoir accès à la prévente.
 
The 20/20 Experience est déjà, selon plusieurs critiques, un des meilleurs albums de l’année. L’album aura droit à sa suite le 30 septembre prochain. Écrit et produit par Justin, cet album contiendra 10 nouvelles chansons qui explorent les barrières musicales que les fans ont découvertes dans le précédent album.
 
Ne manquez pas Justin Timberlake au Centre Bell le 31 octobre prochain!
 
Pour plus d’information visitez www.justintimberlake.com ou www.livenation.com.  Hashtag:  #JT2020TOUR

---------
TICKETS ON SALE MONDAY,  MAY 13th AT 10 AM!

Tickets on sale at Bell Centre Box Office
By phone:  1 855 310-2525
Order online: www.evenko.ca
Ticket prices: $63 to $192.50 (taxes and service fees included)

evenko and Live Nation Global Touring are proud to present Justin Timberlake at the Bell Centre on October 31st. 

One of this generation’s most-celebrated entertainers, Justin Timberlake, announced today he will kick off The 20/20 Experience World Tour starting this year on October 31.  After dominating the global charts with the release of his acclaimed new album, The 20/20 Experience, Timberlake will bring his electrifying live shows to fans with a worldwide tour that will run through 2014.  The Grammy® and Emmy® Award-winning artist’s first tour in six years will visit dozens of countries throughout North America, Europe, South America and Australia. 

The 20/20 Experience World Tour is promoted worldwide by Live Nation Global Touring.  Justin also revealed today the musical journey started on The 20/20 Experience will continue with the worldwide release of the new album on September 30, 2013. 
 
The 20/20 Experience World Tour will kick off in North America starting on October 31 in Montreal, Quebec at the Bell Centre with dates lined up for Las Vegas, Dallas, Houston, Phoenix, Atlanta and more. Justin Timberlake’s all-new fan club, The Tennessee Kids (#TNKids), will have access to a pre-sale starting on May 7 at 10 AM local time.  Fans should visit www.justintimberlake.com/tennesseekids to register for the fan club and receive a special code to access the pre-sale.  
 
The 20/20 Experience, already hailed by critics as one of the year’s best albums, will continue with a second worldwide release this year on September 30.  Written and produced by Justin, the epic album will feature 10 all new songs that explore the sonic boundaries fans discovered with the music found on this year’s earlier release. 
 
Don’t miss Justin Timberlake at the Bell Centre on October 31st! 
 
For more information please visit www.justintimberlake.com or www.livenation.com.  Hashtag:  #JT2020TOUR

410869262383343.description:
C'est parti !

À nous de donner forme à la ville dont nous rêvons.  

Cette invitation s'adresse à toutes les personnes qui ont manifesté le désir de s'impliquer au niveau de l'équipe organisatrice de 100en1jour Montréal. Certains étaient au lancement, merci d'être venus en si grand nombre ! D'autres se joignent tout juste à nous, vous êtes les bienvenus!


Notre première réunion aura lieu :

Jeudi 27 mars, de 18h à 21h
au Loft Dowd (371 rue Dowd, loft 201)
 
Lors de cette rencontre nous voulons accueillir chaleureusement les nouveaux visages au sein de l'équipe et démarrer le processus de planification du projet. L'intention est de prendre le temps pour se donner une vision claire des différents rôles que chacun va jouer dans 100en1jour Montréal.

Nous sommes tous invités à apporter des grignotines à partager. 

D'ici là, nous vous souhaitons tout le meilleur !

À mercredi !

Un grand merci au Collectif Les Aiguilles tournent à l'Envers  d'avoir si généreusement offert de nous accueillir. 
 
--
 
And so we start again!
Let us create together the city of our dreams.
 
We would like to invite all who have expressed an interest in getting involved in the organization of 100in1day Montreal, to join us for a first meeting.

Some of you came to the launch, we want to thank you for coming! For those of you who will come for the first time, welcome!

This first meeting will take place:

Thursday, march the 27th, 6PM to 9PM
at the Loft Dowd (371 rue Dowd, loft 201)

This meeting will allow us to warmly welcome the new faces, and get fully started with the planning of this amazing project. We would like to take the time to draw a common vision of the different roles that we want to play going forward.

We are also invited to bring along snacks to share.

Until then, we wish you all the best!

See you all thursday!

Our warmest thanks to the Aiguilles tournent à l'envers collective for welcoming us.

415760845234267.description:
BookThug and Librairie Le Port de tête invite you to celebrate the launch of Here In There, the new poetry collection by Angela Carr. With special guest Jacob Wren, author of Polyamorous Love Song.

Book Launch for Here in There by Angela Carr
with guest reader Jacob Wren
Sunday May 4, 2014
Librairie Le Port de tête
262, avenue du Mont-Royal Est
Montréal (Québec)
6:00-8:00 pm
Free. Books will be for sale. Refreshments will be served.

Here in There, Angela Carr’s third book of poetry, is a lyrical petition to the human faculty of attention. In constant motion, the poems locate unusual instances of connection. They ask, do we give or pay attention? And what do we attend to? How do we decide what merits our attention? In a world where stillness is elusive, can we give or pay attention to anything but that which outlives our own distraction? Turning our attention to the senses, in Here in There, touch informs inscription, credit becomes an audible vibration. Carr’s poems form traceable and untraceable patterns, disappearing economies of material.

Carr achieves an exquisite balance of sensual fleshiness, confession, and conceptual abstraction.
- Sonnet L'Abbé, The Globe and Mail

Carr makes texts, bodies, and buildings pliable.
- Canadian Literature 

Author Bios:

Angela Carr is the author of two previous poetry books, Ropewalk (2006; nominated for the McAuslan First Book Prize) and The Rose Concordance (BookThug 2009). As a translator, she translated Coït by Chantal Neveu (BookThug 2012). Originally from Montreal, Carr now lives in New York City, where she teaches Creative Writing at The New School for Liberal Arts. Her new collection Here in There is now available from BookThug.

Jacob Wren creates literature, performances and exhibitions. His books include Unrehearsed Beauty (1998), Families Are Formed Through Copulation (2007), and Revenge Fantasies of the Politically Dispossessed (2010) and Polyamorous Love Song (BookThug 2014). He is co-artistic director of Montreal-based interdisciplinary group PME-ART, Wren travels internationally with alarming frequency and frequently writes about contemporary art. Follow Wren at http://www.radicalcut.blogspot.com and http://jacobwren.tumblr.com.
415760845234267.name: Montreal Book Launch for Angela Carr with Guest Jacob Wren

418324294965423.description:
After the unprecedented success of qawwali maestro Ustad Rahat Fateh Ali Khan in 2012, it is with great pleasure that Skylawn Travel and the South Asian Alliance of Quebec, in association with Qatar Airways, bring you the iconic SONU NIGAM LIVE at the esteemed Salle Wilfrid-Pelletier of the Place des Arts on SUNDAY JUNE 8, 2014.

The recipient of over 30 acclaimed awards for Best Male Playback Singer, Sonu Nigam has become a household name in the Bollywood music scene. From performing Mohammad Rafi’s “Kya Hua Tera Wada” live on stage at the young age of four, to being the first ever host of the hit TV show ‘Sa Re Ga Ma Pa’, to recording his voice for one of India’s most successful albums to date (Deewana), Sonu Nigam is India’s most versatile entertainer today.

Having worked with Bollywood’s top rated music directors such as A.R. Rahman, Ilayaraja, and Vishal Shekhar, Sonu Nigam has become a major force in the music industry. He provided playback singing for Hindi movies and won many prestigious awards, notably for the title song of the film Kal Ho Naa Ho. Other hits include Abhi Mujh Mein Kahin (Agneepath, 2012), Shukran Allah (Kurbaan), Ishq Bina (Taal), Suraj Hua Maddham (Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Ghum), Do Pal Ruka (Veer Zaara), and Yeh Dil Deewana (Pardes).

Sonu Nigam, accompanied by his 30-member entourage of musicians, co-singers, and dancers promises to deliver a Bollywood musical experience par excellence in this special production of unforgettable hits!

Showtime 6pm, doors 5pm.

Joignez-vous à nous pour sensibiliser la population aux allergies, à l'asthme et à l'anaphylaxie tout en profitant d'une sortie familiale remplie de plaisir! 

Une marche de 3,2 km ainsi qu'un circuit d'activités pour les familles vous seront proposés Nous invitons les enfants à se déguiser pour l'occasion. Même si aucune nourriture ne sera distribuée sur place, nous vous invitons à apporter votre repas car une aire de pique-nique sera aménagée pour vous.

Nous avons hâte de marcher à vos côtés!

Visitez le https://aaia.raiseapp.ca/the-locations/montreal pour plus d'information et pour vous inscrire. 

~~~~~~

ENGLISH 

Come join us for a fun filled day to help raise awareness for allergies, asthma and anaphylaxis. 

There will be a 3.2km and a family walk with activities.Children are invited to dress up. Although no food will be offered on site, everyone is invited to bring their own meal to enjoy in our picnic area. It is sure to be a fun family event for all.

We look forward to walking with you soon!

Go to https://aaia.raiseapp.ca/home for more information and to register.

Heatwarmer est devenu connu localement pour leurs performances live vivifiantes et virtuoses, et quatre ans après leur formation, ils présentent leur premier album et se lancent dans leur deuxième tournée américaine. __________ “One of the most interesting bands happening right now in Seattle” - DJ Sharlese, KEXP ?“...super-intricate instrumentation that takes uncountable unexpected twists and turns” - Seattle Weekly “So good your heart will ache” - Megan Seling, The Stranger Emerging from the unlikely confluence of Seattle’s underground Rock and avant-garde Jazz scenes is a new offering of shape-shifting, ornately arranged pop tunes by Heatwarmer. Their genre-elusive sound is inflected with echoes of Classical, Jazz, Arena Rock, Bollywood Soundtrack, Mambo, African drumming, and 80s synth pop. 428789080574979.description:
Après 10 ans d'absence, le baseball majeur est de retour à Montréal !

METS vs BLUE JAYS
Série de 2 matchs préparatoires / Stade Olympique
Vendredi 28 mars 2014 à 19h05 
Samedi 29 mars 2014 à 13h05

Billets en vente aux guichets du Stade Olympique
Par téléphone: 1 855 790-1245
Commandez en ligne: www.evenko.ca
Billet : 18$/ 28$/ 43$/ 58$/ 83$ (taxes et frais de service inclus)
* Forfaits spéciaux et tarif pour enfants aussi disponibles

evenko est fier de présenter une série de deux matchs entre les Blue Jays de Toronto et les Mets de New York au Stade olympique, les 28 et 29 mars 2014.

La formation torontoise, sous la direction du directeur général montréalais, et ancien membre des Expos de Montréal, Alex Anthopoulos, recevra ses homologues new-yorkais en préparation à la 145e saison du baseball majeur. La série qui mettra aux prises les représentants de la Ligue américaine, les Blue Jays, et les porte-couleurs de la Ligue nationale, les Mets, permettra aux amateurs de baseball de la grande région métropolitaine de renouer avec le baseball majeur et de voir à l’œuvre plusieurs des meilleurs joueurs du baseball majeur avec les puissants frappeurs Edwin Encarnacion, José Bautista et José Reyes ainsi que le lanceur R.A. Dickey et l’excellent joueur d’avant-champ canadien Brett Lawrie.

« Nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de voir les Blue Jays se produire à Montréal et donner aux amateurs de baseball de Montréal la chance de voir à nouveau du baseball majeur. Connaissant l’amour et la passion du baseball des amateurs au Québec, cette expérience sera sans contredit émotive pour plusieurs. Nous espérons que ces matchs sauront les intéresser aux Blue Jays et à raviver leur intérêt pour le baseball majeur », a indiqué Paul Beeston, président et chef de la direction, Blue Jays de Toronto.

Les deux formations n’en seront pas à une première série de matchs. Entre 1997 et 2012, depuis la tenue des matchs inter-ligues, elles se sont affrontées à 21 reprises, soit 12 fois à Toronto et neuf fois au domicile des Mets. Ces derniers, que les amateurs de baseball connaissent bien, l’ont emporté 15 fois, essuyant six revers. En sol canadien, les deux équipes ont une fiche de six victoires et autant d’échecs. Le dernier match entre les Jays et les Mets remonte au 20 mai 2012, alors que les Mets avaient signé un gain de 6 à 5, au Rogers Centre.

« Étant moi-même originaire de Montréal, je suis convaincu que cette série de deux matchs sera un événement mémorable. J’ai débuté ma carrière dans l’organisation des Expos et assisté à de nombreux matchs au Stade olympique. Ce sera électrisant de voir à nouveau le stade vibrer au rythme du baseball majeur », de dire Alex Anthopoulos, vice-président principal et directeur général, Blue Jays de Toronto.

Dans le cadre du retour du baseball majeur à Montréal, Baseball-Québec sera directement impliqué puisque des spécialistes seront sur place afin d’offrir des cliniques de baseball sur le terrain, le dimanche 30 mars. Afin de promouvoir le développement du sport chez les jeunes partout en province, Baseball-Québec participe à de nombreuses initiatives et programmes qui seront mis de l’avant dans le cadre de ces deux matchs au Stade olympique.

« Après plus d’une décennie sans baseball majeur à Montréal, nous sommes fiers d’avoir l’occasion de présenter ces deux matchs préparatoires entre deux équipes de premier plan et, du même coup, offrir aux partisans de baseball du Québec, du baseball de qualité tout en contribuant à l’essor et au développement du baseball grâce à l’implication de Baseball Québec », a ajouté Jacques Aubé, vice-président exécutif et directeur général, evenko.

Partenaire financier de l’événement, Tourisme Montréal est fier de soutenir cette initiative qui contribuera au rayonnement de Montréal sur la scène du sport professionnel et réanimera la flamme des Montréalais pour le baseball.

Les amateurs de baseball pourront se procurer des billets dès le samedi 14 septembre sur le site evenko.ca. Ceux qui se procureront des billets pour les deux rencontres profiteront d’un rabais de 10 %. Des prix spéciaux pour enfants sont également disponibles.

------

After a 10 year absence, major league baseball returns to Montreal!

METS vs. BLUE JAYS 
Two-game series / Olympic Stadium
Friday, March 28, 2014 at 7:05pm
Saturday, March 29, 2014 at 1:05pm

TICKETS ON SALE SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 14 AT 10AM

Tickets on sale at the Olympic Stadium box office
By phone: 1 855 790-1245
Order online: www.evenko.ca
Ticket prices: $18/ $28/ $43/ $58/ $83 (taxes and service fees included)
* Special packages and children rates also available

evenko is proud to present a two-game series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the New York Mets on March 28-29, 2014 at Olympic Stadium. 
The Toronto franchise, under the direction of Montreal-born general manager and former Expos member Alex Anthopoulos, will host its New York counterparts in preparation for Major League Baseball’s 145th season. The series, featuring the American League Toronto Blue Jays and the National League Mets, will give Montreal baseball fans an opportunity to reconnect with Major League Baseball and to see several of the best Major League Baseball players in action, including power hitters Edwin Encarnacion, José Bautista and José Reyes, as well as pitcher R.A. Dickey and outstanding Canadian infielder Brett Lawrie.

“We are excited to bring the Blue Jays to Montreal play in Montreal and give the fans a taste of Major League Baseball again. This will be a very meaningful experience knowing the strength and passion of baseball fans in Quebec. We hope that these games will rekindle their interest in the Blue Jays and Major League Baseball,” said Paul Beeston, Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO.

This will not be the first series of games between the two teams. Between 1997 and 2012, since the beginning of interleague games, both teams have faced each other on 21 occasions; 12 times in Toronto and nine times on the Mets’ home field. The Mets, which are well known to Montreal baseball fans, won 15 games, and lost six. On Canadian soil, the two teams each have a record of six wins and six losses. The last game between the Jays and the Mets goes back to May 20, 2012, when the Mets won 6-5, at Rogers Centre.

“Being from Montreal personally, this is going to be a great thrill. I started my career with the Expos and spent many a game at Olympic Stadium. It will be exciting to see the Big O come to life again with Major League Baseball,” said Alex Anthopoulos, Toronto Blue Jays Senior Vice-President and General Manager.

As part of this Major League Baseball event in Montreal, Baseball Québec will be directly involved with specialists on site to offer baseball clinics on the field on Sunday, March 30. To promote the development of the sport among young people throughout the province, Baseball Québec will participate in many initiatives and programs that will be put forward as part of this two-game series at Olympic Stadium.

“After more than a decade without Major League Baseball in Montreal, we are proud to welcome this special baseball event between two leading teams. We are also pleased to provide Quebec fans with exciting baseball while contributing to the growth and development of the sport, thanks to the involvement of Baseball Québec,” added Jacques Aubé, evenko Executive Vice-President and General Manager.

As a financial partner of the event, Tourisme Montréal is proud to support this initiative, which will help showcase the Montréal professional sports scene and revive the passion Montrealers have for baseball.

Baseball fans will be able to buy tickets starting September 14 at 10 a.m. on evenko.ca. Those who purchase tickets for both games will get a 10% discount. Special prices for children are also available.

***************************************************


Matt Tomlinson raconte ses histoires avec un accent anglophone et une poésie bien à lui. Avec le lancement de son EP Ou Presque l’auteur, compositeur et interprète chante son indie folk cinématographique en français, pour la toute première fois. Accordant sa sensibilité musicale anglaise à un verbe français beau et dépouillé, il révèle quatre titres qui, préambules à un tout nouvel album à paraître à l’automne. Accompagné sur scène par son complice et réalisateur Yves Desrosiers, Tomlinson transporte le public dans un univers drole, rafine, au charme indubitable.
-----
The release of Ou Presque marks the French language debut for multi-faceted musician, Matt Tomlinson. Interweaving English musical sensibilities with pertinent French texts brings Tomlinson’s signature cinematic indie folk to a new level. The 4 song EP offers a sampling of the full-length album, slated for release this fall. Produced by Yves Desrosiers - who also joins him on stage - Ou Presque shimmers with humour, imagery, and insight.
